Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:11  
xwiki-bridge - (09:18): [Vincent Massol] silviar: hi  
xwiki-bridge - (09:18): [silviar] Vincent: Hi!  
xwiki-bridge - (09:18): [Vincent Massol] thanks for working on the watchlist app doc  
xwiki-bridge - (09:18): [silviar] you're welcome :)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:18): [Vincent Massol] it looks quite nice  
xwiki-bridge - (09:18): [Vincent Massol] I just have a small comment  
xwiki-bridge - (09:18): [silviar] thanks  
xwiki-bridge - (09:19): [Vincent Massol] the screenshot and features you describe can depend on 2 factors  
xwiki-bridge - (09:19): [Vincent Massol] - the XE version  
xwiki-bridge - (09:19): [Vincent Massol] - the skin used  
xwiki-bridge - (09:19): [Vincent Massol] we need to agree on how we handle this  
xwiki-bridge - (09:19): [Vincent Massol] for the whole xwiki.org  
xwiki-bridge - (09:20): [Vincent Massol] here are some ideas:  
xwiki-bridge - (09:20): [Vincent Massol] - either we make the doc only for the latest version and in this case we should probably export the pages at release time so that people using the older version can refer to them  
xwiki-bridge - (09:20): [Vincent Massol] or we keep the doc for 2 releases   
xwiki-bridge - (09:21): [Vincent Massol] (same as we do for the source code)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:21): [Vincent Massol] 2 release right now would be: XE 2.1 and XE 2.2  
xwiki-bridge - (09:21): [Vincent Massol] personally I think I prefer option 1. I'll send an email about it  
xwiki-bridge - (09:21): [Vincent Massol] second point: the skins  
xwiki-bridge - (09:22): [Vincent Massol] we need to decide if we want to document only for the latest skin or take into account other supported skins  
xwiki-bridge - (09:22): [Vincent Massol] right now supported skins are: colibri, toucan and albatross (not sure exactly though about albatross)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:23): [silviar] I've only used colibri for the screenshots recently, but there are indeed screenshots of all the skins thoughout the documentation  
xwiki-bridge - (09:23): [Vincent Massol] again we need to decide here what we want to do  
xwiki-bridge - (09:23): [Vincent Massol] for ex on the watchlist app page  
xwiki-bridge - (09:23): [Vincent Massol] you said "starting with XE 2.1..."  
xwiki-bridge - (09:23): [Vincent Massol] which is not correct  
xwiki-bridge - (09:23): [Vincent Massol] it should be "starting with XE 2.1 and the Colibri skin...."  
xwiki-bridge - (09:23): [silviar] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (09:24): [Vincent Massol] but still  
xwiki-bridge - (09:24): [Vincent Massol] we need to decide if we also document for Toucan/Alabtross  
xwiki-bridge - (09:24): [Vincent Massol] I'll send some emails to ask for opinions on the list  
xwiki-bridge - (09:24): [Vincent Massol] please participate to the thread! :)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:25): [silviar] This means an increased ammount of time dedicated to documenting more or less the same thing. If the users decide they need this I could do this for all 3 skins. Otherwise I think the effort could be better used in creating other documents  
xwiki-bridge - (09:25): [silviar] I will :)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:26): [silviar] If we make the doc for the latest version do you want me to keep only the documentation with the new action menus?  
xwiki-bridge - (09:26): [silviar] or should I wait for a response from the users before i make any modification?  
xwiki-bridge - (09:27): [Vincent Massol] no you can continue as you're doing now  
xwiki-bridge - (09:27): [silviar] ok  
plunden joined #xwiki at 09:30  
xwiki-bridge - (09:36): [Vincent Massol] mail sent  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:36  
lucaa left #xwiki at 09:37  
xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Vincent Massol] lucaa: CTRL button doesn't work for me  
xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Vincent Massol] it shows the contextual menu  
xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [lucaa] yes, it seems to be the meta key on mac. I'll fix that doc now  
xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Vincent Massol] ok it's ALT  
xwiki-bridge - (09:37): [Vincent Massol] yes  
xwiki-bridge - (09:38): [lucaa] alt? not the apple?  
xwiki-bridge - (09:38): [Vincent Massol] it's the alt  
xwiki-bridge - (09:38): [lucaa] ok...  
xwiki-bridge - (09:38): [Vincent Massol] command key works too  
xwiki-bridge - (09:38): [Vincent Massol] both work  
xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [lucaa] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [Vincent Massol] mmm  
xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [Vincent Massol] now I can click anywehre and it's stuck  
xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [Vincent Massol] without having to press alt or command  
xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [lucaa] yes, it's a bug. press alt, click, then close and it will go away  
xwiki-bridge - (09:39): [lucaa] the UI is very very far from being perfect  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [lucaa] I will document that too  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Vincent Massol] ok it doesn't go away but nm  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Vincent Massol] I can annotate everything, the panels, etc  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Vincent Massol] even the logo  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Vincent Massol] is that a feature?  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [lucaa] no, it's a bug  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [Vincent Massol] the highlight doesn't work for me  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [Vincent Massol] I can't get my annotation highlighted  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [lucaa] because you're using a global user  
xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [Vincent Massol] ah  
xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [lucaa] you should use a local user so that you can set yourself an annotation color  
xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [lucaa] because the users class is only modified locally to have colors  
xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [Vincent Massol] I see  
Enygma` left at 09:47 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:48  
xwiki-bridge - (10:01): [lucaa] anyone knows what we use DummyUser on the incubator for? can I reset the password?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:02): [lucaa] or even better, does anyone know the password?  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:08  
xwiki-bridge left at 10:13 (  
xwiki-bridge joined #xwiki at 10:14  
xwiki-bridge - (10:37): [tmortagne] Vincent Massol: can't we filter event on sandbox it does not bring much value here  
xwiki-bridge - (10:37): [tmortagne] i mean playground  
xwiki-bridge - (10:37): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: yep that's a feature to be added  
xwiki-bridge - (10:37): [Vincent Massol] you can filter right now with a hack though  
xwiki-bridge - (10:37): [Vincent Massol] before it's done properly in the app  
xwiki-bridge - (10:37): [Vincent Massol] go ahead  
xwiki-bridge - (10:38): [tmortagne] where should i look ?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:44): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: otp  
xwiki-bridge - (10:44): [Vincent Massol] it's on dev.xwiki.org  
xwiki-bridge - (10:44): [Vincent Massol] IRC.IRCBot from memory  
xwiki-bridge - (10:46): [tmortagne] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (10:49): [anamarias] I see Template, Sheet and Classes have been put each in different spaces for this manager application http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/application-manager/src/main/resources/ What was the reason for that, and what are the best practices in creating spaces for the documents of your application?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:50): [anamarias] I was used to put all classes, sheets, templates, macros, etc in a space called SpacenameCode  
xwiki-bridge - (10:50): [jvdrean] anamarias: it used to be a best practice a long time ago  
xwiki-bridge - (10:50): [jvdrean] the current one is the one you saw, AppCode space  
xwiki-bridge - (10:51): [anamarias] so what goes in which space, are there others or a documentation page?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:52): [jvdrean] anamarias: the current one is the one you saw, one space for everything: AppCode space  
xwiki-bridge - (10:53): [jvdrean] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:53): [anamarias] but this one also has XAppClasses, XAppManager, XAppResources, XAppSheets, etc  
xwiki-bridge - (10:54): [anamarias] they're not all in XAppCode  
xwiki-bridge - (10:55): [jvdrean] yes because the app is quite old and does not follow the latest conventions  
xwiki-bridge - (10:56): [jvdrean] if it was written today it'd have only one space  
xwiki-bridge - (10:56): [anamarias] ah, so the one at this location http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/application-manager/src/main/resources/ is the old one!  
xwiki-bridge - (10:56): [anamarias] not the other way around  
xwiki-bridge - (10:57): [jvdrean] exactly  
xwiki-bridge - (10:57): [anamarias] ok, thanks  
xwiki-bridge - (11:00): [tmortagne] Vincent Massol: done, hope i did not broke it ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (11:01): news  
xwiki-bridge - (12:30): [Vincent Massol] guys we have 3 tests failing on hudson: http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/275/testReport/  
xwiki-bridge - (12:30): [Vincent Massol] apparently for teh same reason:  
xwiki-bridge - (12:30): [Vincent Massol] ERROR: Element //div[@class='panel expanded QuickLinks'] not found  
xwiki-bridge - (12:30): [Vincent Massol] jvdrean: any idea?  
xwiki-bridge - (12:31): [jvdrean] looking  
xwiki-bridge - (12:31): [jvdrean] we have an additional $ "panel $expanded QuickLinks"  
xwiki-bridge - (12:34): [sdumitriu] But that selector is not that good  
xwiki-bridge - (12:34): [sdumitriu] Why don't you select just the QuickLinks?  
xwiki-bridge - (12:34): [sdumitriu] The panel won't always be expanded  
xwiki-bridge - (12:35): [jvdrean] me ? :)  
xwiki-bridge - (12:35): [Vincent Massol] we  
xwiki-bridge - (12:35): [sdumitriu] Whoever wrote that  
xwiki-bridge - (12:36): [jvdrean] we agree it's not a good selector, the $ shouldn't be there anyway  
xwiki-bridge - (12:37): [jvdrean] have we allowed velocity sets to null ?  
xwiki-bridge - (12:37): [Vincent Massol] yes  
xwiki-bridge - (12:37): [sdumitriu] Yes  
xwiki-bridge - (12:38): [jvdrean] ok, that's the reason  
xwiki-bridge - (12:38): [jvdrean] #set($expanded = "expanded")  
xwiki-bridge - (12:38): [jvdrean] #set($expanded = $xwiki.getUserPreferenceFromCookie($cookieName))  
xwiki-bridge - (12:38): [jvdrean] the second call overwrites the default value with null  
xwiki-bridge - (12:38): [Vincent Massol] oh I thought it was a non breaking change....  
xwiki-bridge - (12:39): [Vincent Massol] so potentially it's causing bugs in several locations  
xwiki-bridge - (12:39): [Vincent Massol] glurps  
xwiki-bridge - (12:39): [Vincent Massol] sdumitriu: what's your plan? :)  
xwiki-bridge - (12:40): [sdumitriu] Hunt them down and squash them? :)  
xwiki-bridge - (12:40): [Vincent Massol] yes but it seems like it's an afterthought  
xwiki-bridge - (12:41): [Vincent Massol] you mean: wait for someone to report the bug and fix them?  
xwiki-bridge - (12:41): [Vincent Massol] it's not very proactive  
xwiki-bridge - (12:55): [Vincent Massol] is someone fixing the tests? (re ""panel $expanded QuickLinks")  
xwiki-bridge - (13:29): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: you have restarted the bot after you made the change?  
arkub left at 14:04 (calvino.freenode.net irc.freenode.net

xwiki-bridge - (14:17): [tmortagne] Vincent Massol: no, i just made the change  
xwiki-bridge - (14:17): [Vincent Massol] ok I'm restarting hten  
xwiki-bridge - (14:17): [tmortagne] ok  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 14:18  
xwiki-bridge - (14:18): [Vincent Massol] done  
Lukemon\_ joined #xwiki at 14:34  
xwiki-bridge - (14:47): [anamarias] what is \*Default category\* field in Wiki Macro class for? why isn't a Category field instead? Are they the sam thing?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:47): [Vincent Massol] it can be overriden by admins  
xwiki-bridge - (14:47): [Vincent Massol] this is why it's the default one  
xwiki-bridge - (14:48): [Vincent Massol] ie the one to be used if not overriden  
xwiki-bridge - (14:48): [Vincent Massol] http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WikiMacroTutorial should be improved to explain this  
xwiki-bridge - (14:49): [Vincent Massol] asirir: is it documented anywhere?  
Lukemon left at 14:49 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:50): [Vincent Massol] (how to override categories, default category vs actual category)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:50): [asirir] Vincent Massol, anamarias: I forgot to update the doc when categories were introduced.  
xwiki-bridge - (14:51): [Vincent Massol] btw I need to do the same for multi CM....  
xwiki-bridge - (14:51): [Vincent Massol] (update the doc)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:52): [asirir] categories are common for both rendering / wiki macros.. same goes for multi CM (?) i think this should be documented in one place (IMO)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:53): [asirir] i mean java / wiki macros  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [Vincent Massol] asirir: could be described here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingMacros + link to a topic in the admin guide  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [Vincent Massol] we'll need to create a page in the admin guide for administering the rendering  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [Vincent Massol] right now there's already some content here:  
xwiki-bridge - (14:56): [Vincent Massol] http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HConfiguringWikiSyntaxesanddefaultSyntax  
xwiki-bridge - (14:56): [Vincent Massol] we could extract all the admin config options into a top level page in the admin guide  
xwiki-bridge - (14:59): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: btw http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/URL+resolution seems more DevGuide to me whereas ShortURL is Admin Guide  
xwiki-bridge - (15:00): [Vincent Massol] asirir: so wdyt?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:00): [Vincent Massol] to repeat it means 2 things:  
xwiki-bridge - (15:01): [Vincent Massol] 1) Add some small explanation about default category vs actual category on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingMacros with a link to the AdminGuide's rendering options  
Lukemon\_ left at 15:01 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:01): [Vincent Massol] 2) Add a Rendering configuration top level page in the Admin Guide + refactor current rendering options located in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HConfiguringWikiSyntaxesanddefaultSyntax and move them to that top level page  
Lukemon\_ joined #xwiki at 15:01  
xwiki-bridge - (15:02): [asirir] Vincent Massol: sounds good, we can add register / unregister wiki macros documentation also in admin guide page (once it is implemented).  
xwiki-bridge - (15:02): [Vincent Massol] refister/unregister?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:02): [tmortagne] Vincent Massol: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/URL+resolution is not dev guide, it's a general document entry point for URL management in XWiki with links to differents configurations  
xwiki-bridge - (15:03): [Vincent Massol] ah yes got it  
xwiki-bridge - (15:03): [Vincent Massol] hmmm not sure since it's not for admins  
xwiki-bridge - (15:03): [Vincent Massol] might be better in DEvGuide  
xwiki-bridge - (15:03): [tmortagne] it's ùainly used for admins  
xwiki-bridge - (15:03): [tmortagne] to understand what they need to configure  
xwiki-bridge - (15:03): [Vincent Massol] tmortagne: it's much closer to devs than to admins IMO  
xwiki-bridge - (15:03): [Vincent Massol] devs need it too  
xwiki-bridge - (15:04): [Vincent Massol] all architecture stuff  
xwiki-bridge - (15:04): [tmortagne] sure but devs need everythings admin stuff included  
xwiki-bridge - (15:04): [Vincent Massol] actually  
xwiki-bridge - (15:04): [Vincent Massol] it's architecture stuff  
xwiki-bridge - (15:04): [Vincent Massol] which is either in Code.Mdoules  
xwiki-bridge - (15:04): [Vincent Massol] or in DevGuide  
xwiki-bridge - (15:04): [Vincent Massol] when we have the URL module  
xwiki-bridge - (15:04): [Vincent Massol] Code Module  
xwiki-bridge - (15:04): [Vincent Massol] s/Code Module/it'll be in Code Module/  
xwiki-bridge - (15:06): [Vincent Massol] - architecture: in Code.Modules  
xwiki-bridge - (15:06): [Vincent Massol] - dev tutorials: in Dev Guide  
xwiki-bridge - (15:06): [jvdrean] can't .. put .. bucky balls down ..  
xwiki-bridge - (15:06): [Vincent Massol] - admin tutorial: in Admin Guide  
xwiki-bridge - (15:06): [Vincent Massol] jvdrean: hehe  
xwiki-bridge - (15:06): [Vincent Massol] I have played for about 2 weeks with them but now I don't play so often  
xwiki-bridge - (15:07): [jvdrean] what about the kids ?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:07): [Vincent Massol] same  
xwiki-bridge - (15:07): [Vincent Massol] they played a lot with them for 2 weeks  
xwiki-bridge - (15:07): [Jérôme Velociter] jvdrean: I can set you free  
xwiki-bridge - (15:07): [Vincent Massol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:07): [jvdrean] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:07): [Jérôme Velociter] just send them over to me  
xwiki-bridge - (15:07): [Jérôme Velociter] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:08): [Vincent Massol] once you know how to do all the shapes it becomes a bit boring  
xwiki-bridge - (15:10): [lucaa] me too me too, I volunteer for getting somebody rid of unwanted bucky balls  
xwiki-bridge - (15:11): [Vincent Massol] lucaa: it's not what you think :)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:11): [Vincent Massol] hehe  
xwiki-bridge - (15:11): [lucaa] Vincent Massol: what did I think?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:11): [Vincent Massol] don't get excited  
xwiki-bridge - (15:12): [Vincent Massol] hey nice stuff: http://themha.com/airlock/  
xwiki-bridge - (15:41): [lucaa] Vincent Massol, tmortagne, as the xwikibot already mentioned, a diagram of my approach for annotations renderers is now available at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Design/AnnotationFeature/annotationsRenderer.png . if you want / have time to look at it, I would also have some additional questions (besides an opinion on the approach)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:41): [Vincent Massol] ok checking  
xwiki-bridge - (15:41): [Vincent Massol] in the meantime you could check my mail on your side ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:42): [Vincent Massol] sounds complex to read Anca  
xwiki-bridge - (15:42): [Vincent Massol] ok grabbing a piece of paper....  
xwiki-bridge - (15:42): [Vincent Massol] where's the entry point?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:43): [Vincent Massol] we''ll need something simpler when we document it IMO  
xwiki-bridge - (15:43): [Vincent Massol] it's too detailed  
xwiki-bridge - (15:44): [Vincent Massol] and btw that's why I hate class diagrams  
xwiki-bridge - (15:44): [Vincent Massol] (they're not good for architecture description)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:44): [Vincent Massol] anca: all I see on the diagram is that there's an Annotation REnderer  
xwiki-bridge - (15:44): [Vincent Massol] is there anything else to check?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:46): [Vincent Massol] do you have a diagram for the whole flow?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:46): [lucaa] we can talk if you want, I mean voice  
xwiki-bridge - (15:47): [lucaa] implied answer is no  
xwiki-bridge - (15:47): [Vincent Massol] (with the Rendered being one black box in that diagram)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:47): [Vincent Massol] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (15:47): [lucaa] (no I don't have a flow diagram)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:47): [lucaa] but I can make one fast  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [Vincent Massol] jvdrean: I don't recall if this is fixed:  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [Vincent Massol] "For some reason, the drop down menus at the top of the screen only work for  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [Vincent Massol] Admin users.  I suspect we have changed the access rights somewhere we  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [Vincent Massol] shouldn't have, but I can't figure out where.  Can someone help point me in  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [Vincent Massol] the right direction?"  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [jvdrean] it is  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [Vincent Massol] ok, you want to answer?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [jvdrean] I was actually :)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [Vincent Massol] :)

xwiki-bridge - (16:26): [flavius.olaru] Hi, what version of YUI does come bundled with XWiki Enterprise?

xwiki-bridge - (16:28): [flavius.olaru] while the last stable release is 2.8
